page.title: 07Racton Tower
page.content: Racton Tower was built in 1770 by a man called Lord Halifax. In 1771 it was used by smugglers for signalling ships at sea. Racton Tower is situated near the Hants Border a few miles east of Rowlands Castle Station. It was errected at a cost of Â£10,000 pounds. In 1771 it is said that Lord Halifax hung himself in Racton Tower. It was a recognised landmark from the channel for vessels wishing to enter Chichester, or Lanchester Harbours. Recently it has been fenced in because of falling bricks but the fence was demolished some time ago. You can gain direct access to the Tower by a public bridle-path which passes it.
